author: Special Correspondent
text:
Sabarimala, despite being a major national pilgrim centre, does not have even a fool-proof water treatment plant. The Kerala Water Authority has been supplying drinking water to the pilgrim centre, visited by millions every year, just after chlorinating (‘super-chlorination’ in KWA parlance) the piped water for the past several years.

Now, the authorities are exploring the possibility of supplying drinking water to the pilgrims after purifying it by Reverse Osmosis (RO), even as experts warn that cholrinated water cannot be treated through the reverse osmosis process.
title: Water treatment plant needed
